name: 2022 Toyota Tundra
description:
Overview

The Toyota Tundra is all-new this year with improved infotainment and a new hybrid engine option. It includes a revised suspension system for a smoother ride and plenty of standard safety features, yet it still doesn't offer the wide array of configurations and engines of its competitors. The Toyota Tundra is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 10 trim levels. The most popular style is the SR5 CrewMax 5.5' Bed 3.5L 4WD, which starts at $48,200 and comes with a 3.5L V6 Twin-Turbo engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Tundra is estimated to deliver 17 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Powerful and efficient hybrid engine available
Much improved infotainment system
Long list of standard safety features

Cons

Fewer configurations than competitors
Only two engines are available
Less towing capacity than competitors
Overall Assessment
The all-new 2022 Toyota Tundra is a full-size truck with improvements on all fronts. It now offers two engines, including a hybrid for better fuel efficiency. The suspension has been modified to improve the ride quality, and the all-new infotainment system with a massive available touchscreen is more responsive. There are six trims, rear-wheel or four-wheel drive, two cabs, and three-bed lengths. Its breadth of options make it versatile enough to work for family life or work life. But it still doesn't have quite the range of configurations as its competitors. The interior is also improved with better materials and more comfortable seating to match the Tundra's smoother ride. The Ram 1500 has a superior ride with more trims and more available engines. The Ford F-150 boasts the highest towing and payload rating in the segment. The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers more engines and more trims in its lineup but a less appealing interior.

name: 2022 Ford F-150
description:
Overview

The Ford F-150 holds the title of best-selling full-size truck largely due to its multiple trims, wide range of configurations, and high tow rating. It doesn't ride as smoothly as some rivals, but the F-150 is still a top contender among pickups. The Ford F-150 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 8 trim levels. The most popular style is the XLT SuperCrew 5.5' Box 4WD, which starts at $49,770 and comes with a 3.3L V6 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This F-150 is estimated to deliver 19 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Impressive towing and payload
Wide range of trims
Multiple engines

Cons

No diesel engine option
Pricing climbs quickly
Overall Assessment
The Ford F-150 has long sat at the top of the full-size pickup truck segment. Its capability is unrivaled, boasting the highest towing and payload ratings of any full-size light-duty truck. A fuel-efficient hybrid is available, and the new electric F-150 Lightning (reviewed separately) hits showrooms this spring. The choices continue with rear-wheel or four-wheel drive, three bed lengths, and three cab configurations. The competition is fierce from popular alternatives such as the Ram 1500, which has a smoother ride and more attractive interior, and the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 with its multifunction tailgate. There's also the Toyota Tundra if you're looking for similar features at a lower price.

name: 2022 Hyundai Santa Cruz
description:
Overview

Part crossover, part pickup truck, the Hyundai Santa Cruz offers a tantalizing tangle of virtues. With a high-output engine and all-wheel drive, it will enable the urban dweller to run errands during the week and enjoy on- and off-road adventures on the weekend. The Hyundai Santa Cruz is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the SEL AWD, which starts at $30,435 and comes with a 2.5L I4 engine and All Wheel Drive. This Santa Cruz is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 27 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Economical and performance powertrains available
Large user interface screens
Unique combination of utility and size

Cons

Limited interior storage
No hybrid powertrain option

Overall Assessment

In the 1970s, mini pickup trucks were all the rage. Japanese brands led the charge, and several domestic brands offered versions of their own as the phenomenon grew. Flash-forward 50 years and Hyundai is hoping to tap into the same zeitgeist with its all-new Santa Cruz "sports adventure vehicle." But the concept has some new tricks, namely the five-passenger cabin that enables the Santa Cruz to transport a young family or two couples in comfort. Mini pickups never offered that. And few small pickups offered nearly the performance that the Santa Cruz offers with its optional 281-horsepower turbocharged engine. Inside, the creature comforts are exactly what one would expect from a recently designed compact crossover. And that's not surprising since the Santa Cruz is based on the brand-new Hyundai Tucson SUV. In some ways, the Santa Cruz channels the Tucson directly. But there are areas, such as the powertrain choices, for example, where the Santa Cruz goes its own way.

Because the Santa Cruz is creating its own segment, there are few vehicles to compare it to. One straight-up competitor is the 2022 Ford Maverick, which is very similar to the Santa Cruz but veers in a slightly more trucklike direction. The Santa Cruz is about 4 inches shorter than the Ford Maverick and rides on a slightly shorter wheelbase. The other obvious comparison is the Tucson because it and the Santa Cruz share a platform and many components. The Tucson is shorter than the Santa Cruz in overall length by about a foot with a significantly shorter wheelbase as well.

name: 2022 Ford Maverick
description:
Overview

Compact, affordable, and fuel-efficient, the all-new Ford Maverick is a new breed of pickup that's perfect for those who want the versatility of a truck with city-friendly sizing. The Ford Maverick is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the XL SuperCrew FWD, which starts at $22,490 and comes with a Hybrid 2.5L I4 engine and Front Wheel Drive. This Maverick is estimated to deliver 23 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Low starting price
City-friendly dimensions
Standard fuel-efficient hybrid engine

Cons

No hybrid all-wheel-drive combination
Modest hauling and towing capacity

Overall Assessment

The all-new Ford Maverick is the smallest and least expensive pickup on the market. Unlike Ford's larger Ranger and F-Series pickups, which have rugged, real-deal truck chassis, the Maverick is mechanically similar to the Ford Escape crossover, so it's less of a work truck and more of a fun truck. With a standard hybrid engine or an available turbocharged gas engine, the Maverick is also the most fuel-efficient pickup available. And its size makes it ideal for urban environments.

That doesn't mean the Maverick, which is only offered in a four-door crew cab body style, is any less of a truck. It can still tow and carry a payload, and its highly customizable bed fits almost every lifestyle. And Ford offers a rugged FX4 package for extra off-road capability. Inside, there's a surprising amount of space, with seating for five and plenty of cubbies to hold your stuff. In addition to larger traditional pickups such as the Ranger and Nissan Frontier, the Maverick competes with the Hyundai Santa Cruz, which is a similar concept to the Maverick.

name: 2022 Nissan Frontier
description:
Overview

With a fresh, square-jawed design, a segment-best standard 310 horsepower, a large-screen infotainment system, and a wide array of driver-assist safety tech, the redesigned Nissan Frontier is now a serious contender in the midsize pickup truck segment. The Nissan Frontier is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the SV Crew Cab 2WD, which starts at $34,085 and comes with a 3.8L V6 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Frontier is estimated to deliver 18 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Standard 310-horsepower V6 engine
Up-to-date infotainment features
Comfortable front seats

Cons

Most driver-assist tech costs extra
No rear-seat climate-control air vents
No telescopic steering wheel

Overall Assessment

No automaker has had a longer run in the U.S. compact and midsize pickup market than Nissan. That presence waned in recent years, however, as Nissan's entry, the midsize Frontier, grew stale while newer, fresher competitors entered the segment.

A redesign of the Nissan Frontier for 2022 restores its market mojo with all-new sheet metal featuring a square-jawed front end, massive grille, muscular flanks, and wide stance. The ruggedly handsome exterior opens to a modern, attractive cabin fitted with the latest in infotainment technology and driver-assist features. Under the skin, the new Frontier gets quicker ratio steering, suspension refinements aimed at improving handling, and new hydraulic body mounts that reduce cab "jiggle."

There are still two cab layouts: King Cab and Crew Cab. The King Cab is Nissan's name for a four-passenger extended cab with short, rear-hinged doors and two occasional-use rear jump seats. The five-passenger Crew Cab has four regular-size, front-hinged doors, and a three-person rear bench seat. The King Cab is only available with base S and midlevel SV models.

As with most other midsize pickups, the Frontier offers two bed sizes. A bed measuring 5-feet long comes standard with the Crew Cab, while a 6-footer is included with the King Cab and long-wheelbase SV Crew Cab.

The segment-leading Toyota Tacoma is due for a complete redesign in a year or so, but in the meantime the Frontier offers more horsepower, a roomier back seat in both cab styles, better handling, more comfortable and ergonomically pleasing front seats, and a more up-to-date infotainment system than the current model-year Tacoma. This Frontier, however, doesn't offer the carlike ride and handling of the Honda Ridgeline or the bigger towing ratings of the Ford Ranger and Jeep Gladiator, or the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon diesels.

name: 2022 Ram 1500
description:
Overview

The 2022 Ram 1500 easily sits near the top of the segment for its luxurious interior and smooth, comfortable ride. It has a wide range of engines, including high-performance options, that make it easy to find a Ram 1500 that handles the workday and weekend fun. The Ram 1500 is a 6-seater vehicle that comes in 9 trim levels. The most popular style is the Laramie Crew Cab 5'7" Box 4WD, which starts at $55,335 and comes with a 3.6L V6 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This 1500 is estimated to deliver 19 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Performance trims
Upscale interior
Well-mannered ride

Cons

Lower maximum towing capacity than competitors
Advanced safety features are limited
Overall Assessment
The 2022 Ram 1500 full-size pickup delivers truck capability with a smooth, comfortable ride that's unmatched in the segment. It has a wide range of available configurations with quad or crew cabs, rear- or four-wheel drive, and two bed lengths across nine trims and multiple special editions. Capability includes a maximum tow rating of up to 12,750 pounds and a max payload of up to 2,300 pounds. Its range of engines is ready to manage your workday needs or weekend adventures. And a high-performance variant is included for those who want a truck that can handle the rigors of high-speed off-roading. Pricing starts at $34,500 with the top trim coming in at $72,000. The Ford F-150 has a lower starting price and is the only full-size truck with an available hybrid engine. The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 has a higher tow rating with three available bed lengths.

name: 2022 Ford Ranger
description:
Overview

The Ford Ranger is a solid midsize truck that offers quick acceleration, a nimble feel, and impressive mileage. A bouncy ride and a dated interior are the only drawbacks to this otherwise capable pickup. The Ford Ranger is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the XLT SuperCrew 5' Box 4WD, which starts at $37,185 and comes with a 2.3L I4 Turbo engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Ranger is estimated to deliver 19 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Turbocharged engine feels stronger than its numbers suggest
Strong towing and hauling capability for the class
Impressive fuel economy

Cons

Firm suspension makes for a busy ride
Interior design looks bland compared with newer competitors
Only one engine offered

Overall Assessment

When it comes to midsize pickups, the Ford Ranger is one of the best in its class thanks to a wide range of configurations, pleasant demeanor on the road, and good value for the money. Some might consider its single engine offering a drawback, but we like the performance of the standard 270-horsepower, 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder engine. It works well with the 10-speed automatic transmission to deliver a responsive feel and solid fuel mileage numbers. We're less impressed by the Ranger's ride quality as it's on the firm side, which makes for a busy ride on rough roads.

Offered in three levels of trim, two body styles (extended or crew cab) and rear- or four-wheel drive, the Ranger offers a wide range of setups. A number of options packages with different themes make the Ranger stand out among its many rivals. Notable competitors to the Ranger include the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon twins and the Toyota Tacoma, the latter being the segment's top seller.

name: 2022 Honda Ridgeline
description:
Overview

The Honda Ridgeline offers a useful mix of car and truck attributes. Its unique construction provides the comfort of a car, while its truck bed offers the utility of a midsize pickup. The Honda Ridgeline is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the RTL-E, which starts at $45,365 and comes with a 3.5L V6 engine and All Wheel Drive. This Ridgeline is estimated to deliver 18 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Standard all-wheel drive
Wide cargo bed
Car-like ride and handling

Cons

Competitors offer more towing capacity
Only one engine available
High price compared to other midsize trucks

Overall Assessment

Introduced in 2006, the Honda Ridgeline has always been a unique pickup truck. Instead of the traditional body-on-frame construction with a solid-axle rear end, the Ridgeline adopted unibody construction with an independent rear suspension. While most midsize pickups offer cab-style, bed-length, and engine choices galore, the Ridgeline comes with a five-passenger crew cab body, all-wheel drive, and a single available engine. While it looks like a conventional midsize pickup, it drives differently. Competitive midsize trucks, such as the Toyota Tacoma, Nissan Frontier, Chevrolet Colorado, GMC Canyon, and Ford Ranger are very similar to each other in construction, capabilities, and looks. The Jeep Gladiator is another midsize truck that stands apart.

The Ridgeline is about 2 inches shorter than the shortest Tacoma and Colorado, and it's half an inch shorter than the crew-cab Ranger. Toyota offers a long-wheelbase Tacoma that is 15 inches longer than the Ridgeline. The Toyota, Chevy, GMC, and Nissan pickups present a variety of configurations that the Ridgeline doesn't match.

name: 2022 Toyota Tacoma
description:
Overview

A top choice among midsize pickups, the Toyota Tacoma is known for its durability, wide variety of options, and no nonsense design. Its low seating position is an acquired taste and it's not overly powerful, but the Tacoma delivers all of the things you expect from a truck in this class. The Toyota Tacoma is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the SR Double Cab 5' Bed V6 4WD Automatic, which starts at $34,630 and comes with a 3.5L V6 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Tacoma is estimated to deliver 18 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Legendary durability
Most safety features come standard
Off-road trims are exceptionally capable

Cons

Doesn't feel very powerful, especially with the base engine
Fuel economy is average with either engine

Overall Assessment

For many years, the Toyota Tacoma was the default choice when it came to midsize trucks. It offered everything truck buyers were looking for and had few competitors. There are now more choices in this segment, but the Tacoma remains a top contender. Much of its appeal comes from a reputation for durability, off-road capability, and a lineup that offers everything from a two-wheel-drive extended cab up to a four-wheel-drive TRD Pro. Base models come standard with a four-cylinder engine with 159 horsepower while higher trims get a larger V6 with 278 hp. Both cab styles feature four doors, but the extended cab uses smaller reverse opening rear doors while the crew cab gets standard, full-size rear doors. Both 5- and 6-foot bed lengths are available along with rear- or four-wheel drive. Upgrade packages from Toyota Racing Development (TRD) gives the Tacoma improved performance on the road or in the dirt depending on the package. The Tacoma's interior favors function over form as most of the controls use large knobs and buttons. Recent improvements to the user interface have made the touchscreen controls easier to operate, but it's still not the best system in the class.

Key competitors include the Ford Ranger and newly redesigned Nissan Frontier, along with long-time rivals, the Chevrolet Colorado and GMC Canyon twins. There's also the Jeep Gladiator which matches the Tacoma for off-road capability but lacks the diverse array of configurations.

name: 2022 Nissan Titan
description:
Overview

The Nissan Titan is an attractive choice for its long list of standard safety equipment and robust powertrain. But rival trucks offer more engine options and better towing capability. The Nissan Titan is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the SV Crew Cab 2WD, which starts at $45,855 and comes with a 5.6L V8 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Titan is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 21 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Extensive range of standard safety features
High-horsepower V8
Spacious, comfortable interior

Cons

Limited powertrain selection
Less fuel-efficient than rival pickups
Competing models have higher tow ratings

Overall Assessment

The Nissan Titan has strengths that truck buyers value, starting with its confident V8 engine. The V8 helps the Titan get going in a hurry, and it packs more horsepower than base engines in rival trucks such as the Ford F-150 and Ram 1500. The Titan's roomy cabin is another plus. It offers comfortable accommodations that make long days behind the wheel less of a chore. And to top it all off, this Nissan comes loaded with standard safety features. All Titan trucks have amenities such as blind-spot warning and forward-collision mitigation.

Still, other trucks eclipse Nissan's full-size pickup in critical areas. For example, the Ram 1500 and Chevrolet Silverado 1500 have more cab styles and engine choices. And the Titan lags the F-150 in towing capacity and fuel efficiency.

name: 2022 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 LTD
description:
Overview

The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 LTD is a perfect workhorse and weekend adventure truck for those on budget. We like it best when equipped with the big, powerful V8 engine option. The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 LTD is a 6-seater vehicle that comes in 8 trim levels. The most popular style is the RST Crew Cab Short Bed 4WD, which starts at $51,395 and comes with a 5.3L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Silverado 1500 LTD is estimated to deliver 15 MPG in the city and 20 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Sophisticated turbocharged engine
Extremely capable
Comfortable cabin

Cons

Dated compared to key rivals
Bouncy ride
Interior feels basic
Overall Assessment
The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 LTD should look familiar. It's the same as the 2021 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. Chevy has decided to keep the popular truck in production and in showrooms right along with the heavily redesigned Chevrolet Silverado 1500, which gets new exterior styling, a new interior, and other upgrades. The Silverado 1500 LTD is for budget-conscious buyers looking for a comfortable and capable full-size pickup but who don't need all the latest technology. Just about everything carries over from 2021, including the Silverado's choice of five excellent engines. The list features two big V8s and a torquey turbodiesel. Buyers can also choose between three bed sizes, three cab styles, and eight trim levels, including two off-road ready Trail Boss models. The Silverado 1500 LTD offers vast interior space, user-friendly trailering technology, and respectable gas mileage for its class. It's also a good value. It competes with the more modern Ford F-150, Ram 1500, and of course, the redesigned Chevrolet Silverado 1500.

name: 2022 Jeep Gladiator
description:
Overview

The Jeep Gladiator brings everything that consumers love about the Jeep brand to the midsize pickup segment. It performs the work of a midsize truck yet can engage in off-road activities. The Jeep Gladiator is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 10 trim levels. The most popular style is the Rubicon, which starts at $50,705 and comes with a 3.6L V6 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Gladiator is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 23 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Traditional Jeep styling in a pickup truck
Excellent infotainment systems
Unparalleled off-pavement abilities

Cons

Higher-priced than competing midsize trucks
On-road ride and handling aren't its strong suits

Overall Assessment

If you do a lot of off-roading — or just want to look like you do — the Jeep Gladiator is a top pick in the midsize truck segment. While it offers the styling of the iconic Jeep Wrangler, it also borrows some components and engineering philosophy from the well-regarded Ram 1500 full-size pickup. This results in a vehicle that can go anywhere a Wrangler can go while carrying a serious amount of cargo in its ample pickup truck bed. While some other midsize trucks, such as the Toyota Tacoma, have proud off-road histories and serious modern-day capabilities of their own, the Gladiator was designed and engineered to be the best off-roader among pickup trucks, bar none. The Gladiator's array of three separate four-wheel-drive systems is just one example of how serious Jeep is about keeping that crown.

The five-passenger four-door Jeep Gladiator is more than 5 inches longer than the short-wheelbase crew-cab Toyota Tacoma and nearly 8 inches longer than the crew-cab short-bed version of the Nissan Frontier. Toyota also offers a long-bed crew cab that is 7 inches longer than the Gladiator. But comparing the Gladiator directly to conventional pickups like the Tacoma and Frontier is flawed because they can't match the Gladiator's fun-to-drive, open-air nature. Try to take the doors off of a Tacoma or lower the windshield of a Frontier flat onto the hood. The Gladiator can do both.

name: 2022 Ford Super Duty F-350
description:
Overview

The Ford F-350 sits in the middle of the American brand's Super Duty lineup, offering additional size and strength over the venerable F-150. The stats are impressive: a maximum gooseneck towing capacity of 35,750, up to 1,050 lb-ft of torque, and a payload limit of 7,850 lbs. The F-350 pays just as much attention to interior space and comfort, giving passengers a luxurious and tech-forward cabin on upper trim levels. The Ford Super Duty F-350 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the LARIAT Crew Cab 6.75' Box SRW 4WD, which starts at $60,695 and comes with a 6.2L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Potent and refined gas engines
Jaw-dropping diesel power
Top-notch towing strength
Desirable tech amenities available

Cons

Base trim lacks some common tech features
Limited's MSRP rivals luxury brands
Towing software isn't as clever as some
Overall Assessment
One of three Super Duty trucks offered by Ford, the F-350 is a massively capable -- and comfortable -- choice for shoppers wanting over-the-top strength. It's a great choice for businesses needing top-tier payload and towing abilities, and Ford's integrated safety technology makes the trip to and from work sites less of a chore. Inside, passengers get great amenities and a luxury feel, but upper trim levels sport a prohibitive price. Still, the Ford F-350 is a must-drive for prospective truck buyers looking for outsized toughness and the refinement to match.

name: 2022 Chevrolet Colorado
description:
Overview

The midsize truck market has heated up in recent years, and the Chevrolet Colorado has been around the longest. Still, Chevy has kept the truck fresh with a strong V6 engine, solid towing and off-road capability, a wide range of trims, and options to suit every budget. The Chevrolet Colorado is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the Z71 Crew Cab Short Box 4WD, which starts at $39,495 and comes with a 3.6L V6 engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Colorado is estimated to deliver 17 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Comfortable ride
Powerful V6 and high-torque diesel engines
Hard-core off-road model

Cons

Low-grade interior plastics
Older design
Minimal standard safety tech

Overall Assessment

The Chevrolet Colorado is designed to serve a wide variety of customers. The midsize pickup comes in two-bed lengths (5-foot-2-inch and 6-foot-2-inch) and two cabs (Extended and Crew). And every model is available in two-wheel drive or four-wheel drive. In addition to the WT (Work Truck), LT, and Z71 trims, there's a range-topping ZR2 expressly designed for tough off-road conditions. It matches the capabilities of the top Jeep Gladiator.

Under the hood of most Colorados lies a strong 306-horsepower V6. A four-cylinder is the base engine on some models, and a more expensive diesel is also available. The V6 offers more power and quicker acceleration than most midsize trucks. Although the Colorado is the elder statesman of the midsize pickup class, it's still a strong contender with a comfortable ride, easy maneuverability and, on some models, off-road capability that outshines most 4X4 trucks.

The competitors' models are a year or more newer than the Chevy. And Colorado's sales numbers have fallen slightly every year for the past four years. The Gladiator and Ford Ranger outsell the Chevy by a slight margin, while the class-leading Toyota Tacoma outsells it by a wide gap. The all-new 2022 Nissan Frontier looks to be a strong competitor, too. However, for most buyers, the Colorado is an excellent midsize truck.

name: 2022 Ram 3500
description:
Overview

The Ram 3500 is a masterclass in hauling strength, the hulking flagship of Ram's lineup of trucks offering a maximum towing capacity of 37,100 lbs. Dual rear wheels are available for earth-shifting traction. Shoppers can opt for a Mega Cab four-door model with its vast interior space, and all Rams provide a surprisingly smooth ride and high-quality cabin materials, making this hard-working truck quite luxurious. The Ram 3500 is a 6-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the Tradesman Crew Cab 8' Box 4WD, which starts at $52,985 and comes with a 6.4L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Best-in-class towing abilities. The luxurious interior is a pleasant surprise. Comfortable ride quality.

Cons

It can be hard to maneuver in tight spaces. Most driver-assistance features cost extra.
Overall Assessment
With its rugged construction and immense towing and payload capacities, the Ram 3500 is ready to handle any workload. Its roomy interior is one of the most refined in its class, with impressive material quality and user-friendly controls. Driver safety technology is available, as is a massive 12.0-inch touchscreen. While some rivals are more maneuverable in traffic, the Ram 3500 is an unparalleled towing machine for enormous tasks, perfect for transporting a large RV or boat, with the comfort and amenities to make the journey as enjoyable as the destination.

name: 2022 GMC Sierra 1500
description:
Overview

The GMC Sierra 1500 is a full-size truck with good capability, roomy front seats, and a well-appointed interior. It has high tow ratings and can carry plenty of cargo, but its ride quality doesn't match the comfort of the competition. The GMC Sierra 1500 is a 6-seater vehicle that comes in 8 trim levels. The most popular style is the Elevation with 3SB Crew Cab Short Bed 4WD, which starts at $55,995 and comes with a 2.7L I4 Turbo engine and Four Wheel Drive. This Sierra 1500 is estimated to deliver 17 MPG in the city and 20 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Powerful engines
Spacious interior
Luxurious top trims

Cons

Pricing climbs quickly with options
Ride is stiffer than the competition

Overall Assessment

The GMC Sierra 1500 has a wide range of luxurious trims, especially with the Denali and new Denali Ultimate. GMC improved the interior of the Sierra 1500 this year and it shows in both the look and feel of material choices. Top trims get open-pore wood and rich leathers, but quality materials abound in all models. There are four engine options, including a diesel, which help make the Sierra 1500 a capable work truck. Infotainment includes a new larger touchscreen with a wide range of features. Also, there are numerous standard safety features and the new Super Cruise driver-assist technology on Sierra Denali pickups.

In comparison, the Ford F-150 offers more trim levels, a hybrid, and better off-road capability in its Raptor trim. The Ram 1500 has an equally upscale interior and a more comfortable ride.

name: 2022 GMC HUMMER EV
description:
Overview

The new GMC Hummer EV pickup boasts impressive power and off-road capability, but its high starting price and limited towing and payload ratings narrow its appeal. The GMC HUMMER EV is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the Edition 1 Crew Cab, which starts at $110,295 and comes with an Electric engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Impressive power
Unique off-road capabilities
Up to 350 miles of driving range

Cons

Cumbersome size
Lower tow rating than rival EV pickups
High price point

Overall Assessment

The GMC Hummer EV is an all-new, all-electric pickup truck. The Hummer lineup will eventually include a range of trucks and SUVs with one big difference from the Hummers of old. Instead of gas-guzzling monsters, the new range will be entirely electric. The first to reach production is the Hummer EV pickup. The Edition 1 trim, the first available, is sold out. Buyers can join the waiting list for future versions.

The Hummer EV provides excellent off-road capability and a long driving range to maximize time between charges. Its spacious interior can comfortably carry five adults, and the latest driver-assist safety technologies are included. But a six-figure starting price puts it out of reach for many buyers, and low tow and payload ratings might discourage those who need a truck to do serious work.

The Hummer has no direct competitor in terms of size and capability, but those looking for a pickup EV can consider the Ford F-150 Lightning. Its top trim level is priced beneath the Hummer's starting point. The innovative Rivian R1T costs less as well, and provides a much higher tow rating (11,000 pounds compared to the Hummer EV's 7,500-pound rating).

name: 2022 GMC Sierra 2500HD
description:
Overview

The GMC Sierra 2500HD is a heavy-duty full-size pickup that's built to haul big loads with comfort and ease. When outfitted in the most luxurious Denali trim, the 2500 is one of the most refined, upscale, and composed trucks in the class. The GMC Sierra 2500HD is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 5 trim levels. The most popular style is the Denali Crew Cab Standard Bed 4WD, which starts at $71,395 and comes with a 6.6L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Easy to maneuver
Optional all-wheel-drive mode
Smart trailering technology

Cons

Limited off-road capability
No 10-speed transmission for the gas V8 engine
Small infotainment screen

Overall Assessment

The Sierra 2500HD was last redesigned for 2020. So this one is the newest of the heavy-duty pickup trucks. GMC, as well as its Chevrolet sister brand, forged a unique path years ago by offering the only heavy-duty pickup with four-wheel drive and an independent front suspension instead of an old-tech solid front axle. The GM trucks have long been known as some of the easiest to drive and best handling of the workhorse pickups. Plus, GMC offers the upscale Denali model that adds serious luxury to the mix.

But just because a truck is easy to drive doesn't mean it gives up towing or hauling capability. GMC offers two powerplants: the standard 401-horsepower gas-powered 6.6-liter V8 and the 6.6-liter V8 Duramax diesel, which delivers a solid 910 pound-feet of torque. The top Sierra HD can move 3,979 pounds in its bed. And the maximum tow rating for the pickup is 18,500 pounds. GMC offers a great rear camera system that, on some models, provides two trailer views as well as a hitch guidance system. In addition, the GM trucks are the only heavy-duty pickups to offer an all-wheel-drive mode within the 4WD system. That gives the driver confidence when hauling or towing a trailer in foul weather. However, when it comes to off-roading, the Sierra isn't as capable as its rivals. The AT4 off-road package is best suited to dirt roads and mild trails.

name: 2022 GMC Sierra 3500HD
description:
Overview

The GMC Sierra 3500HD is one of the most capable trucks available when it comes to towing. Smart tech features make trailering even easier, but the interior design and quality fall short of the competition. The GMC Sierra 3500HD is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 5 trim levels. The most popular style is the Denali Crew Cab Long Bed 4WD, which starts at $72,795 and comes with a 6.6L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Serious power for serious towing
Cabin is big on space and storage
Smart apps and cameras make towing a breeze

Cons

Interior looks and feels dated
Denali trim isn't as luxurious as other range-topping trucks
Forward visibility is hampered by a huge hood
Overall Assessment
When it comes to serious heavy-duty trucks, there are only three choices, and the GMC Sierra 3500HD is one of the most capable. Properly configured with a stout turbodiesel engine and dual rear wheels, this massive pickup can tow up to 36,000 pounds. In this select class of trucks, only the Ram 3500 beats the GMC, and only by 1,090 lbs. Meanwhile, the Ford Super Duty F-350 is limited to 32,000 lbs. The Sierra is further bolstered by a spacious cabin, versatile MultiPro tailgate, and several tech features that make towing even easier. Curiously, however, adaptive cruise control is not offered. The 3500HD's interior would benefit from a similar refresh as its GMC Sierra 1500 sibling, but it's stuck with a carryover that falls short of rivals' design and quality.

name: 2022 Nissan Titan XD
description:
Overview

The roomy and powerful Nissan Titan XD is the perfect full-size pickup for buyers who need more than a light-duty pickup, but less than a true heavy-duty truck. The Nissan Titan XD is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the PRO-4X, which starts at $57,765 and comes with a 5.6L V8 engine and Four Wheel Drive.

Pros

Big, powerful V8 engine
Surprisingly comfortable ride
Impressive standard safety features

Cons

Competitors offer more body styles
No diesel engine option
Plain cabin design
Overall Assessment
More capable than the standard Nissan Titan, the Nissan Titan XD is the brand's largest, most powerful, and most capable pickup. The XD isn't the heavy-duty option some buyers need for commercial-grade towing and hauling, but it comes with a 5.6-liter 400-horsepower V8 engine, four-wheel drive, an extremely spacious cabin, and a surprisingly smooth ride. That's more standard horsepower than you'll find in the Chevrolet Silverado, Ford F-150, Ram 1500, and the Toyota Tundra. The Titan XD can tow up to an impressive 11,060 pounds and haul up to 2,430 pounds of payload. Every Titan XD also features a popular Crew Cab body style and a 6.5-foot bed, so it's perfect for weekly jobsite duty and weekend adventures with boats, horses, and toys in tow. Unlike its heavy-duty rivals from Chevy, GMC, Ram, and the best-selling Ford F-Series Super-Duty, the Titan XD is not available with a diesel engine, a longer bed, or a dual rear axle. Off-road enthusiasts should check out the Pro-4X model; it's quite good off the pavement.
